Job Title: Market Director, Electric Vehicle Battery (EVB) / Electric Vehicle (EV) - Strategic Projects

Location: Greater Houston

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
Company Description

About Veolia North America

A subsidiary of Veolia group, Veolia North America (VNA) offers a full spectrum of water, waste and energy management services, including water and wastewater treatment, commercial and hazardous waste collection and disposal, energy consulting and resource recovery. VNA helps commercial, industrial, healthcare, higher education and municipality customers throughout North America. Headquartered in Boston, Mass., Veolia North America has more than 10,000 employees working at more than 350 locations across the continent. Please visit our website

www.veolianorthamerica.com

Benefits

Job Description

Veolia's comprehensive benefits package includes paid time off policies, as well as health, dental and vision insurance. In addition, employees are also entitled to participate in an employer sponsored 401(k) plan, to save for retirement. Pay and benefits for employees represented by a union are outlined in their collective bargaining agreement.

An exciting opportunity is available immediately in our Sales, Development and Marketing Team in North America. We are looking for an individual to join our team to lead the growth of Veolia’s services in the new electric vehicle batteries recycling market by developing circular solutions for end of life batteries.

Build the Electric Vehicle battery services market (water / waste / energy) for Veolia.Source lithium battery recycling (and other) opportunities (end of life + production scraps).Develop strategic partnerships to offer a wider range of solutions and / or to enter new markets.Support business units by collaboratively developing growth and sales strategies for target customer segments or selected offers.Support corporate development and business development efforts by providing market and competitive intelligence.

POSITION PURPOSE: As Market Director for EVB/EV you will be directly responsible for building relationships and developing new business opportunities. Your role will require close collaboration with operations teams across Veolia North America’s business units. You will report to the Senior Director Growth Markets.

Primary Duties / Responsibilities

Support development of new services and business models, focused on circular economy (namely battery recycling).Build trust-based relationships with buyers and other stakeholders.Understand customer needs and develop value propositions and offers to meet those needs, combining the full range of capabilities in the Veolia Group.Lead project teams to respond to tender opportunities and to develop bespoke solutions for complex customer challenges.Participate in the development of battery recycling projects.Gather knowledge on the end markets (black-mass / purified salt selling).Aid the development of potential partners.

Notes

This is a hybrid position.Willing to travel 30% of the time in North America.There is one (1) position open and it can be filled in Houston, Austin, Boston, Paramus, or San Francisco.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree with an emphasis in Science, Engineering or Business (preferably Environmental focus); MBA or other advanced degrees a plus.A minimum of 10 years of Industrial, Energy, Water, and/or Environmental business sector(s) with demonstrated experience in Sales and Business Development.Preferable to have past experience in Automotive, Lithium-Ion Battery or Chemical industry.Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to work with people at all levels of the organization.Ability to successfully prioritize, manage complex projects, deadlines, and tasks with little supervision.Collaborative and creative team player with drive for innovation and continuous improvement of systems, processes and tools.Self-starter with strong organization, project management, time management, and problem-solving abilities.Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, including the ability to disaggregate issues, identify root-causes and recommend solutions.Successfully works on multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines.Ability to thrive in a flexible and collaborative environment.

Additional Information

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer! All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Disclaimer: The salary, other compensation, and benefits information is accurate as of the date of this posting. The Company reserves the right to modify this information at any time, subject to applicable law.
